alert.note: Alert for Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 3:54PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Teton County through 430 PM MDT... At 352 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Last Chance to 10 miles northeast of Drummond to near Felt. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mystic Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northwestern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Yellowstone National Park
